Posts.Content: claudgrn wrote: hi, i have a history of fibrocyctic breasts and over 20 years ago, in my 20s had 2 small palpable lumps.removed near the skin surface whicch were benign.  i went for my routine gyne exam in Oct and a lump was felt. i had a diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound and although that lump.was.an obvious cyst( dark well defined circle) the radiologist found a mass that even i could tell looked different than anything else there, looked kind of like a smudged chalk circle.  i had a core biopsy do.e, which showed some aplasia and changes but not cancer.  The radiologist however did.not feel like that correlated witb wbat he saw and recommended a sugical biposy with needle localization which the breast surgeon concurred.  i had the Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: bent the needle? claudgrn claudgrn
